text: João Ubaldo Osório Pimental Ribeiro (23 January 1941 - 18 July 2014) was a Brazilian writer. His best known novel was An Invincible Memory which was a success in the English-speaking world. Several of his books and short stories have been made into movies and TV series in Brazil. Ribeiro was born in Itaparica, Bahia. He had been married three times and had four children. Ribeiro died from a pulmonary embolism on 18 July 2014 in Rio de Janeiro, aged 73. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1941 births Category:2014 deaths Category:Columnists Category:People from Bahia Category:Brazilian novelists
